div.p: ANTONIO: Setting goals and planning for rewards in our future is a great way to motivate ourselves to make low-risk choices.

ANTONIO: But aside from the obvious appeal of being able to accomplish something or purchase something we've always wanted, why is rewarding ourselves for making low-risk choices so important? Let's find out.
ALAN: Making change can be difficult, and sometimes all the work we do to maintain can seem hard or boring.
ALAN: Fortunately, the human brain is wired to respond to rewards, and we can use that by planning ways to reward ourselves for sticking to our new choices.
ALAN: Rewarding ourselves isn't just a motivational gimmick... it has an important biological benefit.
ALAN: When we reward ourselves with positive things, such as doing something fun, or buying something we've saved for, our brains respond by giving us positive feelings.
ALAN: So, if we reward ourselves for making low-risk choices, our lives will feel more satisfying.
